intro: Anerincleistus pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates.
